text:
Rehrig Pacific Company
is a fourth generation
family owned business.

We're a manufacturer
injection molder in plastics,
and we make reusable transport packaging.
Our challenge was being able
to surface all this edge based data
that we were collecting to our customers.
Amazon QuickSight had all the capabilities
that we were looking for.

It had the ability to
generate dashboards quick.

It had the ability to embed
them into our own applications,
and that was very important to us.

What we're really excited
about is the scenario analysis

capability, and that is
coming for Amazon Q

in QuickSight. You can
look at all the data
already in your QuickSight.
You can bring in other data for context,
and by using the tool, the insights
that the analysts are getting are some
that then prompt them to dig deeper.

So what if I make this
change in my configuration?
What will happen in my supply chain?
With the scenario analysis capability,
we're actually now able to use the tool

and automate some of
those analyst functions.

And so it's making them five
to ten times more productive
than than they are today.

So the real benefit for
the customer is being able

to actually see the data
that's happening at the edge,

dig deep into it, and then look
at how they can make changes
and then use the tool again to predict

how those changes will affect
their, their operation.

By enabling our customers to
self-service, their analytics,

it also allows us to focus
on other feature-driven

development to enhance
and drive the product.
